intro: Epilobium × gerardii, commonly known as the common willowherb, is a hybrid species within the Onagraceae family. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant characterized by its erect or spreading growth habit. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its showy, pink to purple flowers are arranged in terminal clusters and bloom in the summer months. Epilobium × gerardii is typically found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and waste areas.
